main event: A bright white light was observed traveling at a high speed and low altitude over Iowa City, Iowa on February 28, 1980.
interesting points: The object was moving at a very high rate of speed, was silent, and had a glow around the entire craft.
The object appeared to defy the laws of aviation that the observer was familiar with.
The object did not have any running lights and did not appear to be leaving or heading to the municipal airport.
The object was estimated to be around 200-300 feet over the rooftops as it passed over the city.
The observer suspected the object could be some type of aircraft that has not yet been developed or made public.
